sources.title: Cross of Iron (1977)
sources.description: Cross of Iron is a 1977 war film directed by Sam Peckinpah, featuring James Coburn, Maximilian Schell, James Mason, and David Warner. Set during World War II on the Eastern Front, focusing on the conflict between Corporal Rolf Steiner, a battle-hardened soldier, and Captain Stransky, an aristocratic officer seeking glory. The film explores themes of survival, camaraderie, and the futility of war as Steiner navigates the harsh realities of combat while Stransky's ambition puts their squad in danger.

sources.title: Iron Cross: The Road To Normandy | Full Movie | Action War | WWll
sources.description:
A captain struggle to survive fighting during WWII. Sent to Normandy as troops are preparing for D-day with scores settled with battle.
2022.  Stars: Tino Struckmann, Olivier Gruner, Kim Sønderholm

metadata.Plot: In 1943, on the Russian front, decorated leader Rolf Steiner (James Coburn) is promoted to Sergeant after another successful mission. Meanwhile, upper-class arrogant Prussian Captain Hauptmann Stransky (Maximilian Schell) is assigned as the new commander of his squad. After a bloody battle of Steiner's squad against the Russian troops led by the brave Lieutenant Meyer (Igor Galo), who dies in combat, the coward Stransky claims that he led his squad against the Russian and requests to be awarded with the Iron Cross to satisfy his personal ambition together with that of his aristocratic family. Stransky gives the names of Steiner and of the homosexual Lieutenant Triebig (Roger Fritz) as witnesses of his accomplishment, but Steiner, who has problems with the Army's chain of command and with Stransky's arrogance, refuses to participate in the fraud. When Colonel Brandt (James Mason) gives the order to leave the position in the front, Stransky does not retransmit the order to Steiner's squad, and they are left alone, surrounded by the enemy and have to fight to survive.
metadata.Writer: Julius J. Epstein, Walter Kelley, James Hamilton
metadata.Actors: James Coburn, Maximilian Schell, James Mason
